page.title: 12FARMING HISTORY
page.content: Mechi Farm was originally called Blennerhasset Farm. In 1864 the second son of Sir Wilfred Lawson visited a model farm in Essex run by Alderman Mechi. He was very impressed by the methods in use there. His father bought him Blennerhasset Farm. He changed its name to Mechi and transformed it into a model farm. He experimented with steam tractors, built a laboratory, and produced liquid manures and fertilizers. He even had his own gas works, providing street lighting for the village. When visiting the farm today it is possible to see the remains of the gas works. In the village there is an old gas-lamp post outside the school. Mr. Lawson also provided the village with a shop and a reading room.
